description: Number of primes in the reduced residue system of n-th primorial number (=A002110(n)).
example: n=3, 3rd primorial is 30, EulerPhi(30)=8, a(3)=8-1=7 since 1 is regarded here a nonprime. See A048597. n=4, 4th primorial is 210, size of its reduced residue system(RRS) is 48 of which 42 is prime and 6 is either composite or 1.
author: _Labos Elemer_
extensions: a(0) prepended and extended by _Max Alekseyev_, Feb 22 2016
